turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: You're looking worried again, Helena?

turns.speaker: HELENA
turns.text: No I'm not.

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: You're looking more worried now than when you "decided to stop worrying"?

turns.speaker: HELENA
turns.text: Alright, I'm worried about Christmas. I wish I hadn't told him I'd be back ..

turns.speaker: HELENA
turns.text: Why can't I stay with you?

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: It's not possible right now.

turns.speaker: HELENA
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: Please don't ask no quest- ions now .. Not right now ..

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: She has an aunt, in Vermont. I'll take her there tonight.

turns.speaker: HELENA
turns.text: I'm going back to the institute.

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: No .. not now ..

turns.speaker: HELENA
turns.text: Don't say that. Don't you <u>dare</u> say that .. <u>I believe you</u>  ..

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: I know you're trying to help me, but you don't understand.

turns.speaker: HELENA
turns.text: <u>Then explain it to me</u>. I got enough darkness, don't I?

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: The man who killed Amber is a psychopath. He was up at the in- stitute to <u>kill you</u> - he don't wanna kill Rose - he was there to <u>kill you</u> - that's the truth - and I didn't wanna tell it to you - but that's the reason I want you to stay at Margie's - coz I can't protect you here ..

turns.speaker: HELENA
turns.text: Why does he want to kill me?

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: Coz he thinks you're a witness.

turns.speaker: HELENA
turns.text: I can't identify him ..

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: He don't know that. I didn't.

turns.speaker: HELENA
turns.text: Then why didn't he kill me?

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: He doesn't need my help.

turns.speaker: HELENA
turns.text: I know about alcohol, John.

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: You do?

turns.speaker: HELENA
turns.text: I'm blind because my father drank.

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: You don't wanna sit here any more, sweetheart ..

turns.speaker: HELENA
turns.text: I wanna be near you ...

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: I think they're gonna arrest me.

turns.speaker: HELENA
turns.text: I don't want them to arrest you.

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: It's not as bad as it sounds .. They can't refuse me bail. Raise bail of my own cognizance & find the best damned lawyer there is ..

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: What are you doing, Travis?

turns.speaker: TRAVIS
turns.text: I been told to take your car in, Sir.

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: TRAVIS
turns.text: I dunno, Sir. Brought you up a Chevy.

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: You got a warrant for this?

turns.speaker: TRAVIS
turns.text: Yes, Sir.

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: Who sought the warrant?

turns.speaker: TRAVIS
turns.text: The man from the F.B.I.

turns.speaker: CITRINE
turns.text: Interview over, Blattis ...

turns.speaker: BLATTIS
turns.text: C'mon, Chief, if it's sensitive, tell me .. I'm not taking notes ..

turns.speaker: CITRINE
turns.text: .. we got a body part. We don't know what it is - probably some kind of hospital debris - we're gonna try and check it out. O.K. Now you know as much as we do ..

turns.speaker: BLATTIS
turns.text: Grateful for your candor, Sir.

turns.speaker: CITRINE
turns.text: Then do me a favor, and keep this outta the newspaper - that dump serves a dozen different communities, we don't even know if it's ours? Till we do I don't want no one worrying about ..

turns.speaker: BLATTIS
turns.text: Wasn't frozen, was it, Sergeant?

turns.speaker: CITRINE
turns.text: Come on, Michael, outta here, the guys trying to move in. I told you what we know, something else, you- 'll be the first to hear about it ..

turns.speaker: ROSS
turns.text: A blind girl can just walk out of here, and you don't know who with?

turns.speaker: GOODRIDGE
turns.text: You find something curious in that?

turns.speaker: ROSS
turns.text: Yeah, I guess I do.

turns.speaker: GOODRIDGE
turns.text: Then let me put your mind at ease .. Firstly, Amber isn't "blind" - she has some useful vision - and second, this isn't a prison, it's a college of higher education - a severe vis- ual disability doesn't mean my stud- ents don't value their independence as much as anybody else - and Amber was a very independent young woman - She decided to leave - so she left ..

turns.speaker: ROSS
turns.text: And you got <u>no</u> <u>idea</u> with who?

turns.speaker: GOODRIDGE
turns.text: No, Sergeant, I got <u>no</u> <u>idea</u> with who. And I might add, that in another six weeks, a hundred and fifty students will be leaving here, & driving away for their Christmas holidays with pe- ople whose name I-won't-know-either ..

turns.speaker: HELENA
turns.text: When did John divorce?

turns.speaker: MARGIE
turns.text: Two or three years ago.

turns.speaker: HELENA
turns.text: What was she like?

turns.speaker: MARGIE
turns.text: Suzanne? Very pretty. She was a semi- professional model. But a policeman's wife she wasn't. So one day, she just packed it and left. And his whole life went straight down the nearest toilet.

turns.speaker: HELENA
turns.text: What does that mean?

turns.speaker: MARGIE
turns.text: You know, he crashed. He just couldn't come to terms with it .. John hates to lose, and he hated losing her .. Every spare minute, he's driving down to San Diego, having a terrible time with her, getting drunk, and driving back .. you just don't believe the amount he drank ..

turns.speaker: HELENA
turns.text: You think he still loves her?

turns.speaker: MARGIE
turns.text: Think he still thinks about her. But not like then. Then was an obsession.

turns.speaker: HELENA
turns.text: I haven't worn heels since I was 16. I don't think I could walk in these?

turns.speaker: MARGIE
turns.text: Sure you can. Anyway, parties are all about standing still ..

turns.speaker: HELENA
turns.text: You think John would like it?

turns.speaker: MARGIE
turns.text: I think John, would <u>love</u> it ...

turns.speaker: MARGIE
turns.text: How you doing on those shoes?

turns.speaker: HELENA
turns.text: Don't mix very well with beer.

turns.speaker: HELENA
turns.text: Is that Margie?

turns.speaker: MARGIE
turns.text: I'm here, honey. I'm right here.

turns.speaker: MARGIE
turns.text: I'm not giving him <u>Pizza</u>. I haven't seem him for a year? I'm gonna cook him a dinner.

turns.speaker: ROSS
turns.text: Dinner's another night, darlin .. This is a drive-by. I got an hour ..

turns.speaker: MARGIE
turns.text: Bobby's out .. What's the hurry?

turns.speaker: ROSS
turns.text: Friday night at City Hall. Got a great chance to frighten the fat.

turns.speaker: MARGIE
turns.text: Freddy's new obsession ..

turns.speaker: MARGIE
turns.text: So tonight she confesses?

turns.speaker: ROSS
turns.text: Tonight I'm feeling lucky ..

turns.speaker: MARGIE
turns.text: No it isn't .. It's Californian ..

turns.speaker: ROSS
turns.text: Even better.

turns.speaker: MARGIE
turns.text: Such a shame .. She's a really sweet kid ..

turns.speaker: ROSS
turns.text: She's a doll. But I wish he hadn't brought her out here.

turns.speaker: MARGIE
turns.text: He's happy, darlin ..

turns.speaker: ROSS
turns.text: I'm sure he is. But gettin in- to the "element" is a bad idea.

turns.speaker: MARGIE
turns.text: Except for the hair color, she looks just like Suzanne?

turns.speaker: ROSS
turns.text: Well, that's who she is. Cept she can't run away.

turns.speaker: MARGIE
turns.text: You want something, darling?

turns.speaker: ROSS
turns.text: I wouldn't mind another B.E.E.R.

turns.speaker: ROSS
turns.text: She married some English prick.

turns.speaker: MARGIE
turns.text: He's not that bad of a guy ..?

turns.speaker: ROSS
turns.text: Got a handshake like a partially excited penis.

turns.speaker: ROSS
turns.text: Hey, we're not talking "talk" tonight.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: No one's gonna make that Gent. Six months investigation, & the nearest we got, we thought he was a sailor.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: Just easy on the words you're putting in my face, Sergeant ..

turns.speaker: ROSS
turns.text: Whass going on here?

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: You think you're the only guy ever worked a homicide? I was a big-city cop too. And I bust- ed the clock on fucken Jennifer. I know more about this man than you'll over know - and that's how I know it ain't him - you- 're investigating a soap-opera ..

turns.speaker: ROSS
turns.text: Alright, guys. We stop this <u>now</u>.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: He tells her, "bye-bye," and she gets "attacked." Well, give me a fucking break! There <u>is</u> no "Ser- ial Killer." Stick her name up in neon, there's still no Serial kil- ler! And I ain't the only one say- ing it. Everyone in this building is saying it. And I mean <u>everyone</u>.

turns.speaker: ROSS
turns.text: Shut up, King Jay ..

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: No, c'mon, Freddy, let's have this out & over. You know what everyone thinks? They think you're making a case coz you found yourself a nice piece of ass. And no one's blaming you for it, I hear she's worth the flowers. But don't come in here get- ting holy over us. Sure I put it in the paper. Coz I wanted to <u>stop</u> this bullshit. I don't want you drunk out- ta your head searching my office ag- ain. it's pissing <u>me</u>, & <u>everyone</u> off.

turns.speaker: TRAVIS
turns.text: You can drive down there, Sir ..

turns.speaker: ROSS
turns.text: I'm already walking. Where is it?

turns.speaker: TRAVIS
turns.text: On the infill. The guy from L.A.'s just gone down there ..

turns.speaker: ROSS
turns.text: He has? .. What's he doing here?

turns.speaker: TRAVIS
turns.text: He was waiting for you, Sir. Wait- ed a good while. Said he'd go down and take a look. I hope that's O.K.

turns.speaker: ROSS
turns.text: Damn A, it's O.K. With a bit of luck I'm goin home. What we got?

turns.speaker: TRAVIS
turns.text: A derelict.

turns.speaker: ROSS
turns.text: Where do you fit in, Trimble?

turns.speaker: TRAVIS
turns.text: His father's the manager, Sir. The kid was up there shooting vermin, and he found the body.

turns.speaker: TRAVIS
turns.text: I wonder what would make him do a thing like that?

turns.speaker: ROSS
turns.text: Don't annoy me, Travis.

turns.speaker: TRAVIS
turns.text: No, Sir.

turns.speaker: TRAVIS
turns.text: I think I found some- thing horrible, Sir

turns.speaker: ROSS
turns.text: Whatta you mean, "horrible?"

turns.speaker: TRAVIS
turns.text: I think I've found a hand.

turns.speaker: TRAVIS
turns.text: The coroner wants to know if we can release the derelict?

turns.speaker: ROSS
turns.text: Ask him.

turns.speaker: AVERY
turns.text: Don't ever stop fucking me!

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Sooner... or later... I'll have to stop.

turns.speaker: AVERY
turns.text: Oh Gawd, oh yes, it's never been better. Never BETTER!!

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: You know.  I don't think we need to do the thing where we tell each other everything!

turns.speaker: AVERY
turns.text: Jerry, this is what intimacy is!

turns.speaker: AVERY
turns.text: Oh -- don't forget tomorrow we have dinner with Wade Cooksey.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: I know about the bachelor party.

turns.speaker: AVERY
turns.text: Who told you?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: One of the accountants.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: The power move is to go unannounced.  Black suit, right?

turns.speaker: AVERY
turns.text: And the egyptian cotton shirt that works with or without the jacket.  Tell me again, how was it left with Cush?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: "Dad says we gwan sleep on it.

turns.speaker: AVERY
turns.text: Ugh!

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Seventy-two clients.  ONE stayed.  Jacket on, tie in pocket. _ 44.

turns.speaker: AVERY
turns.text: Good.  They're all heatseekers!  All of them, everybody. You keep one superstar and they'll all follow. There's no real loyalty, and the first person who told me that, Jerry Maguire, was you.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: I think I was trying to sleep with you at the time.

turns.speaker: AVERY
turns.text: Well, it worked, and I will not let you fail.  You are Jerry Ma- fuckin-guire.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: That's right.

turns.speaker: AVERY
turns.text: King of the Housecalls! Master of the Living Room!

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Okay, this is working.

turns.speaker: AVERY
turns.text: You are not a loser.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Who said anything about "loser?" Where do you get this word "loser?"

turns.speaker: AVERY
turns.text: I'm sorry.  I was on a roll.  I meant something else.  When do you want to leave?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Now.

turns.speaker: AVERY
turns.text: Let's go.  I'll drive you. _ 45.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: I know.  Sorry I threw a scare into our lives there --

turns.speaker: AVERY
turns.text: Don't worry about it -- I never told you what I thought of that memo either --

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Well, no you didn't --

turns.speaker: AVERY
turns.text: You lost your head, it happens.  I'm so fuckin jazzed!  Listen. I'm going to have to fly to Chicago tomorrow, how 'bout if we meet in the Dallas airport and we all fly into New York together for the draft?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: It's a plan --  -- _ 51.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: This can't be happening to me.

turns.speaker: AVERY
turns.text: Jerry!  Do something --

turns.speaker: AVERY
turns.text: I just heard.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: What do I do?  How do I spin this?

turns.speaker: AVERY
turns.text: Oh honey.  It's spun.

turns.speaker: AVERY
turns.text: It's all about you, isn't it? Soothe me, save me, love me --

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Could you just stop moving?

turns.speaker: AVERY
turns.text: I have to finish my job --

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Everything's on the fucking run! Everything --

turns.speaker: AVERY
turns.text: Jerry.  You and I are salespeople. We sell --

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Look, I don't want a --

turns.speaker: AVERY
turns.text: It's not "love me."  It's not "trust my handshake."  It's make the sale. Get it signed.  There shouldn't be "confusion" about that.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Go ahead.  Jump right on into my nightmare.  The water's warm. _ 65.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Tell you what -- I'd prefer loyalty..

turns.speaker: AVERY
turns.text: What was our deal when we first got together?  Brutal truth, remember?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: I think you added the "brutal."

turns.speaker: AVERY
turns.text: Don't say it.  We're both ragged out right now.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: -- stop --

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Listen to me!

turns.speaker: AVERY
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: It's over --

turns.speaker: AVERY
turns.text: Didn't hear it.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: There is something missing here.

turns.speaker: AVERY
turns.text: You've never been alone and you can't be alone --

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Listen to me, it's over.

turns.speaker: AVERY
turns.text: No one has ever dumped me.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: I'm not trying to make history. _ 67.

turns.speaker: AVERY
turns.text: I did the 23 hour nose-route to the top of El Capitan in 6 hours! I can make this work.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: AVERY
turns.text: Oh Jerry.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: You know I didn't ever want to hurt you.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Wait.  Did I just say "hon" to him?

turns.speaker: CHAD
turns.text: Yeah, Dotty. You did. _ 50.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Don't let him stay up too late.

turns.speaker: CHAD
turns.text: Hey, man, tonight I'm going to teach Ray about jazz.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Good, that'll put him to sleep early. No offense.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: He's asleep, right?

turns.speaker: CHAD
turns.text: Yeah, how'd it go with Sportboy?

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Still going.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Let me think about that.  Want something to drink?

turns.speaker: CUSH
turns.text: I see what you're saying.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Wait.  What do you mean?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Cush, Matt -- we have a decision to make.

turns.speaker: CUSH
turns.text: "It's okay to eat fish, 'cause they Don't have any feelings...

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Okay. San Diego just came in with a last-minute scenario.  It's big.

turns.speaker: CUSH
turns.text: "Something in the way.  Yeah."

turns.speaker: CUSH
turns.text: Reporters, Jerry.  They been callin' all night.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Just be friendly and say "no comment."

turns.speaker: CUSH
turns.text: Talking and saying nothing, man, it's an art I have not mastered.

turns.speaker: DOOLER
turns.text: You hear those courtesy laughs, Jerry? There is a seething wrongness at the edges of this party.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Oh come on --

turns.speaker: DOOLER
turns.text: This is fuckin Michael Jordan, man! They should be screaming.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: You're imagining it.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: ... this is... uh... too funny...

turns.speaker: DOOLER
turns.text: They ain't laughing, man. Something's wrong.

turns.speaker: DOOLER
turns.text: Look, Rod, just get on the camel!

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Bill, Rod, wait --

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Airight.  Enough.  I'm pulling him out of this.  This isn't what I had in mind anyway.

turns.speaker: DOOLER
turns.text: Then you shouldn't have begged me to hire him.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: No no...

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Oh, tell the story.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Can I help?

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Oh.  Hi.  I work in your office. I was on the junket to the conference. I'm --

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: I know who y6u are.  You're Dorothy Boyd.  You're in... wait... you're in Accounts.  You have the middle cubicle toward the back with that poster of Albert Einstein morphed onto Shaquille 0 Neal's body.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Hmm.  Pretty good.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Now what did you lose?

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: My son... my mind...

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Well, thanks.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Well, take care.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: And have fun at your bachelor party.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Oh no.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: No no. I knew.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Nnnnn.  I just killed the surprise.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: No, I'm just... anxiously looking past it.  I already had my bachelor party.  It was called "my twenties." See you later.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: I think in this age, optimism like that... it's a revolutionary act.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: You think so?

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Oh tsht. Yes.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: I appreciate that, because some of that stuff... you know, it was two in the morning and...

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: -- the part about "we should embrace what it is still virginal about our enthusiasm" --

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Oh no.  I'm sure it would just make your day to drive us all the way to Manhattan Beach, taking that left down to little tiny Waterloo street where you have to play chicken with oncoming traffic, and your life flashes before your eyes, but -- hey, I've obviously had too much coffee and all -- here's my sister Laurel to pick us up.  Thanks, though. Bye.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Dorothy.  Ray.  A pleasure.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Wonder what he said.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: My favorite aunt is hearing impaired. He said "you complete me." _ 40.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: So I know this is a bad time, but -- you will have a medical program, right?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Sure. Yes. Medical, I don't know.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: And I guess we didn't talk about money.  So, I'll just dive in --

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Give me your number.  I'll call tomorrow.  I'm just a little. I'm a little insane right now.  But it's going to be great.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: No no, I know --

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: But I mean really... wonderfully...  great.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Absolutely.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: That took guts.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Same to you.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Honey -- later, okay?  Whoop.  Wait.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Hello?

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Sorry, that's my son and the nanny. I had the calls transferred to my home so I could go over your stuff.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: No, that's fine.  What calls came in today?

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Wait.  That's yesterday, from the other office. Today is...

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: ... light.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Shit, it's just so frustrating to not be able to talk to Avery --

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Dorothy, let me tell you something, we are back. We are so very very back.  I re-signed Cush. We're set.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: We are?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: It's all going to work.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: I just got goosebumps.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: It's all going to work.  We're going to save the world.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Well, I'm happy for you.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Happy for us.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Happy for us... okay.  Here's the number. 404-453-2222.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Thanks.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Call me later, hon.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Okay, have we gone over everything? Back on Tuesday, right?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Yep.  Have a good time at school, Ray.  Wish me luck.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Hey you.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Hi.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Thanks for inviting me over. Where's the little guy?

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: He's asleep.  Watch out for that lamp.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: I'm glad you're home.  That "alone" thing is... not my specialty...

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Oh my God.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Yeah.  That too.  I broke up with Avery.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Too bad.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Better now than later.  We'll still be friends. I'm dying here.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Jesus, it's a real gash, isn't it?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: And just think if I got her the ring she really wanted.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Sorry.  Uh, let me see, have a seat. I'll get you some aloe vera for that cut too.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Do you have something to drink?

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Sure --

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Beer okay?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Yeah, thanks.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Drinks.  Food.  Plus, I called you a cab.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Good idea.  Thank you.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Don't worry about me.  I can get jobs --

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: We will be fine!

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: -- especially one like this.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: And I am...

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Truth?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Sure.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Me too.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: What you wrote inspired me. _ 79.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: I'm working with you because of that memo...

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Mission... statement...

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Well.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Sorry about this hand.  You know that feeling -- you're not completely embarrassed yet, but you glimpe tomorrow's embarrassment?

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Don't worry about it, boss.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Oh shit.  You said "boss."

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Yeah, I did.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Now I feel like Clarence Thomas.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: No.  No don't feel like Clarence Thomas.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: No, I do.  I feel like Clarence Thomas.  I'm like... harrassing you... right now.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: I may not sue.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Well, good evening.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Good evening.
